page.title: 13Smallholding, Pen-y-Van.
page.content: A general day in the life of a smallholder is very busy. It starts early in the morning because the dogs have to be taken for a walk and then fed and given a drink. There are three dogs called Sir Mutt, (Smutty) who is the oldest and the friendliest dog, he is 13 years old, Bilbery (Billy) is 10 years old, and Friend, (Friendy) also 10. The dogs are exercised along the lane. Then the other animals have to be tended to and cleaned out. The goats are let out to graze, there are 3 goats and 1 kid. There names are Titch, Polly, Bonny and Daniel. You can't get Bonny to move when she doesn't want to, and she bites Wellington boots. The chickens are fed and then the eggs are collected. By now it's lunchtime. After lunch Girlie the horse is checked to see if she has enough food and that she is safe.
